alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 8:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mingo, southwestern Lincoln, northwestern Logan, southeastern Wayne and central Boone Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harts, or 16 miles northwest of Logan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Chapmanville, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Spurlockville, Harts, Chief Logan State, Gill, Hode, Holden, Danville, West Logan, Kermit, Mitchell Heights, Turtle Creek, Crum, Wilsondale, Mud, Breeden, Jeffrey and Verdunville. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 11, and between mile markers 26 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
